name: France
interestingFact: France is the most visited country, attracting over 89 million tourists each year thanks to iconic sites like the Eiffel Tower, the historic Notre Dame Cathedral, and the Palace of Versailles.

name: United States
interestingFact: The US is home to the world's largest economy and the Grand Canyon.

name: China
interestingFact: China’s Great Wall is so vast that it is often described as visible from space, and the Forbidden City in Beijing draws history lovers worldwide.

name: India
interestingFact: India has 43 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, spanning ancient monuments, temples, forts, and natural wonders. These include iconic sites like the Taj Mahal, Qutub Minar, and the Western Ghats, which reflect the country’s rich culture and biodiversity

name: Spain
interestingFact: Spain hosts the vibrant 'La Tomatina' festival, where thousands gather to throw tomatoes in the streets. Its architectural marvels like the Sagrada Familia, ancient castles, and sunny beaches make it a perennial favorite.

name: Italy
interestingFact: Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country.

name: United Kingdom
interestingFact: The British Museum in London contains the largest collection of Egyptian artifacts outside Cairo, and attractions like Buckingham Palace and the Changing of the Guard appeal to millions annually.

name: Germany
interestingFact: Germany is famous for its more than 1,500 types of sausage.

name: Australia
interestingFact: Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth and can even be seen from outer space, making it a haven for divers and nature enthusiasts.

name: Canada
interestingFact: Canada has more lakes than any other country in the world.

name: Brazil
interestingFact: Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest rainforest in the world.
